messages.content: To install ComfyUI-PhotoMaker-Plus, first, install ComfyUI. Then, you can install it through ComfyUI Manager or clone this repo into `custom_nodes` by running the following commands in a terminal: `cd ComfyUI/custom_nodes` and `git clone https://github.com/shiimizu/ComfyUI-PhotoMaker-Plus.git`. Finally, download the model from Hugging Face and place it in a `photomaker` folder in your `models` folder such as `ComfyUI/models/photomaker`.
What features does the `Plus` version of ComfyUI-PhotoMaker offer?

The `Plus` version of ComfyUI-PhotoMaker offers better face resemblance by using `CLIPImageProcessor`, automatic PhotoMaker LoRA detection and loading in the LoraLoader nodes, customizable trigger word, multiple trigger words in the prompt, and extra nodes such as `PhotoMakerStyles` and `PrepImagesForClipVisionFromPath`.
When was the official support for PhotoMaker added to ComfyUI?
The official support for PhotoMaker was added to ComfyUI on 2024-01-24.
Can you explain the citation details for PhotoMaker?

The citation details for PhotoMaker are: `@article{li2023photomaker, title={PhotoMaker: Customizing Realistic Human Photos via Stacked ID Embedding}, author={Li, Zhen and Cao, Mingdeng and Wang, Xintao and Qi, Zhongang and Cheng, Ming-Ming and Shan, Ying}, booktitle={arXiv preprint arxiv:2312.04461}, year={2023}`.
Do I need to manually extract the LoRA from the model?
No, you do not need to manually extract the LoRA from the model as it is automatically done.
